intro: Oenanthe javanica var. japonica, commonly known as Japanese water dropwort, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, white or pale green flowers that appear in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist or wet environments such as marshes, stream banks, and rice paddies. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and often have a mild, somewhat aromatic scent. It is part of the Apiaceae family, which includes many edible and medicinal plants.
